attributes.action: Make the Speakership a Commons position in its own right, remove his MP status
attributes.background: The Speaker (and the three Deputy Speakers) are not allowed to speak or vote in debates which means that they can't represent their constituents properly. We believe that the Speakers should be staff roles rather than being an MP which effectively disenfranchses 4 constituencies (approx 280k people)
attributes.additional_details: This has been considered before by the Procedure Committee and several times (more in the past) before then ( http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201012/cmselect/cmproced/1573/157305.htm ). But we don't agree with the idea that the Speaker is 'most representative of the popular will' (quoted, 22.) since he is not allowed to express the opinion of his constituents in debate. His ability to speak to Government Ministers is not adequate compensation - since they stick to their views anyway.

attributes.action: Protect the graves of  civilians killed by enemy action during WW2
attributes.background: As many of the graves for those civilians who were killed by enemy action during WW2 were public graves in private cemeteries, and they are now unused for 75 plus years- it is possible that the cemetery can reclaim them. as they are effectively rented, and reuse them.
attributes.additional_details: This has already occurred at New Southgate and is threatened at Manor park.  We believe that these graves marked or not should be protected/ if need be by giving them listed status/ TO COMMEMORATE WHAT THE AMERICANS CALL THE GREATEST GENERATION

attributes.action: Ensure Fair access to mental health services and therapies, nationwide.
attributes.background:
The postcode lottery nature of health services must be stopped!! My personal concern is regarding mental health services & available therapies. 

There currently seems to be a one cure for all approach which is ludicrous and ineffectual, and ultimately causes the tax-payer extra money.
attributes.additional_details:
Most PCTs offer Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT). Many ONLY offer this form of therapy. Whereas CBT can offer excellent results for many people, it does not for others.
  It is distressing that all PCTs do not offer a substantial range of therapies. I know this would come at a cost to the NHS. However, it is well known that mental health diagnoses are increasing. It is also widely evidenced that treating mental health efficiently, would relieve stresses on the NHS, UK workforce, and economy.

attributes.action: No more bank bailouts - allow reckless banks to fail
attributes.background: In 2008, due to their reckless gambling with speculative financial products using money they did not actually have, the banks precipitated a worldwide economic crisis. The banks received over £100billion of public money in bailouts and loans to try and prevent them from collapsing completely.
attributes.additional_details: Since 2008, banking practices and culture have not changed enough to prevent a re-occurrence. The burden of saving the banks has fallen mostly on taxpayers, rather than those responsible for the crash. We cannot, as a nation, allow this to happen again. If banks cause another crash, they should be allowed to fail, and not receive another bailout. The government has refused to bail out non-banking industries that provide many jobs (most recently, steel), so they should treat banks the same.

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about behaviour of MPs during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: MPs may raise Points of Order during House of Commons’ debates if they think that an MP has said something offensive or inappropriate. There is no way for members of the public to do this. Members of the public should be able to raise matters of concern with the Speaker, for reporting to the House.
attributes.additional_details: For instance, it was customary for the Speaker to report to the House the conviction of a member by a criminal court even if the sentence did not disqualify them from remaining a member of the House (an example being Mr. Saklatvala in 1926).

attributes.action: Allow all children with JIA to be entitled to DLA
attributes.background: JIA affects every aspect of everyday life, most children with JIA have accompanying conditions & deal with pain everyday. DLA helps to help ease some of the everyday pressures faced as a family.With recent cuts DLA have been taken away even though no there has been no change in the child condition
attributes.additional_details: JIA is a painful disease that causes children to be affected everyday of their lives. As parents is exhausting and distressing seeing your child in constant pain and struggling with simple everyday tasks, other normal kids don't have to even think about doing. Having to fight for a benefit for your child and prove their eligibility is unfair when you have the medication, professional diagnosis and substantial photographic and video evidence to support our claim.

attributes.action: Proclaim a UK Bank Holiday to celebrate HM The Queen's 90th birthday year.
attributes.background: The Queen's official birthday will fall on Saturday 11th June in 2016, marking Her Majesty's 90th birthday. This is a wonderful moment for our nation and will be marked with public holidays around the Commonwealth and with the closure of British High Commissions and Embassies. The UK should join in!
attributes.additional_details: Around the world, Commonwealth nations and oversees UK territories will celebrate with public holidays on either Fri 10th June or Mon 13th June. This petition calls for the same opportunity for the United Kingdom at some point between June 2016 and June 2017, the 90th year of The Queen's life.

attributes.action: Make the DVLA selling your information to private companies illegal
attributes.background: We find it a breach of confidentiality that the DVLA can sell on our vehicle information without permission to private companies because they paid to do so.Therefore we propose a law change in which our vehicle information can only be accessed by law enforcement and local authorities.

attributes.action: Abolish  year 6 sats
attributes.background: The pressure that our children are under is immense.  When the majority of secondary schools do not use the sats results and do their own testing in year 7, why are we subjecting our  children to this pressure? They are becoming disengaged and losing their love of Learning.
attributes.additional_details: I think its about time the Government  realised that our children are not numbers or statistics, but fantastic human beings with great gifts that tests cannot measure. It is important that attainment is measured but use assessments that give positive feedback .For many children year 6 is the best year of primary school, unfortunately their days are being filled with past papers and endless maths and English , missed P.E and science lessons due to booster groups and the nightly revision plans!

attributes.action: Make bullying a criminal offence and/or fine parents of persistent bullies
attributes.background: Like a 3 strike and your out 1st offence of proven bullying a letter gets sent home to parents 2nd time proven bullying letter home to parents plus fixed fine 3rd time proven bullying letter home to parents plus police involvement and/or higher fixed fine
attributes.additional_details: Bully is still a major problem all over the world the facts speak for themselves. ...over 3.2 mil students are bullied each year over 67% students believe schools respond poorly to bullying 71% students report bullying as a problem in their school a staggering 90% of 4th to 8th graders report being bullied 160 thousand students a year drop out of school due to bullying 1 in 4 teachers see nothing wrong with bulling and will only intervene 4% of the time

attributes.action: WCA assessment providers to refund fees if a decision is overturned at tribunal
attributes.background: When assessment providers declare people "fit to work", they rarely consider ESA Regulations 29 and 35. The Work Capability Assessment (WCA) training manual explains these regs but many assessors are unaware of them. This places vulnerable people at risk, e.g. Kenny Bailey
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/man-part-head-missing-who-8037089

I feel that if an appeal is won using these regs when they haven't been considered by an "assessor", then the company is at fault and should not only refund the Government the charge for the assessment (£40-£60 +) but also cover the tribunal fees (£1000+).

attributes.action: Putting signs on bridges and potential suicide spots offering support and hope.
attributes.background: Imagine feeling that there is no hope left in life, nothing to live for. These thoughts go through peoples heads daily and they consequently end their lives. Some people may have no one to talk to, but there are services that can help. I believe putting the information out there will save lives.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics show that suicide is the biggest single killer of men under the age of 45. 
The idea of having signs has already been done in Japans Aokigahara Forest, where hundreds of people have gone to commit suicide. There are now signs which read  "Your life is something precious that was given to you by your parents" while another one states ''Do not be troubled alone." What i'm suggesting is signs with The Samaritans and other local mental health services details on to contact. There is help.

attributes.action: Remove restrictions on the cultivation of hemp.
attributes.background: Hemp produces a minimum of three crops from a single plant,produces fibres, hurds, flowers and seeds, each with a multitude of uses. Environmental impact even if growing wild is enormous, air quality, soil improvement.  Make hemp the UKs next renewable crop.  Lift all restrictions on its production

attributes.action: Introduce a law that requires all business' to donate unused food to food banks.
attributes.background: We need to stop all supermarket's from throwing away left over food/unsold food/unwanted food.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.lovefoodhatewaste.com/node/2163
250,000 tonnes of food waste a year from supermarkets and whole sale.
http://www.lovefoodhatewaste.com/content/cost-food-waste-uk-every-year
The cost of food waste a year from every party is approximately £7,869,000,000

attributes.action: Allow unaccompanied refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background:
According to Europol at least 10000 refugee children are missing. Europol  wans pan-European gangs are targeting minors for sex abuse and slavery.  
The adoption organisations Home for Good and Coram have somewhere between 9,000 and 10,000 families already offering to take unaccompanied minors.
attributes.additional_details:
The only restriction to these children being given one of these homes is current government policy. 
Let’s open the doors to the most vulnerable of children.

attributes.action: Replace the current First Past The Post System with Proportional Representation.
attributes.background: The current system of FPTP is leaving Local Elections in England and Wales with abnormal results. parties are gaining a higher percentage of seats compared with the actual vote they receive, which is leaving the majority of voters unrepresented at Council level.
attributes.additional_details:
For example, in Castle Point, a party achieved 37% of the vote but gained 60% of the seats, while another party there achieved 31% of the vote but gains no seats.

In Oldham, 49.1% of the vote was enough to gain 75% of the seats available.

We are calling for a fairer system to be put in place so that every vote counts.

attributes.action: Prevent building on brown land when it poses a risk to health & the environment
attributes.background: I live near land whose history means it is contaminated. The owners of the land are constantly submitting plans which we have to fight.They have been turned down many times on health and environmental grounds. There should be a maximum number of permitted applications.
attributes.additional_details: The land nearby is contaminated by arsenic, lead, cadmium, asbestos and Mercury-as well as methane gas. The company would release all of this by excavating yet they constantly apply for permission to build-tweaking each plan each time. Thus far we have been successful in our fights but it has been happening for at least thirty years.The dangers remain the same, there should be a limit on the applications made. I am sure this must be happening elsewhere in the country.

attributes.action: Revoke and Repeal the Act of Union 1707 (Treaty of Union)
attributes.background: In 1707 two Acts of Parliament was formed. This is called the 'Treaty of Union'. Revoke that Act to renegotiated and push for separate independent states. ie a 'United England'
attributes.additional_details: The Acts of Union were two Acts of Parliament: the Union with Scotland Act 1706 passed by the Parliament of England, and the Union with England Act passed in 1707 by the Parliament of Scotland. They put into effect the terms of the Treaty of Union that had been agreed on 22 July 1706, following negotiation between commissioners representing the parliaments of the two countries. By the two Acts, the Kingdom of England and the Kingdom of Scotland—which at the time were separate states with separate legislatures, but with the same monarch—were, in the words of the Treaty, "United into One Kingdom by the Name of Great Britain"

attributes.action: Create "Purple Badge"; short term "disability" mobility rights for those in need
attributes.background: People with long term disability can get a blue badge to park in disabled spaces close to buildings. It's hard to get blue badge and if only needed temporarily eg broken leg, after surgery/chemo where walking long distances is hard. Petition for temporary blue badge, given out by medics for set time
attributes.additional_details: When a patient is ill eg after surgery or chemo, getting out can help recovery. However it can be very daunting leaving the house and if you have to park on the opposite side of a large car park this often puts people off going outside. You often need someone with you to support you so getting dropped off and then meeting someone as they park the car is not an option too. There needs to be something for people to get the justified disabled car parking spaces whilst they need it, deemed by a dr

attributes.action: Abloish Road Tax Ved Tax for road Vehicles. Add2/2.5% to tax on petrol.
attributes.background: Currently there is a lot of debate about Vehicle excise duty. Whether there should be a 25 30 or 40 year rolling excemption. If the government added 2/2.5% on to the amount they take in tax form the cost of fuel, this would make the Treasury more money even short term. Fairer for all.
attributes.additional_details: The system I am proposing would be fairer to everyone in the whole country no mater what vehicle they own or drive. This would safe money as the DVLA wold not need to chase up or remind people to renew their Road Tax. The Government is always telling us we are all in this together and moving on. Well if we are all in this together and if we are moving on, this would simplify collecting Road Tax. The additional revenue could be ring fenced and put back into our road system and repair upgrade it.

attributes.action: The UK should negotiate with Australia to form a union between the two nations.
attributes.background:
If Scotland leaves the union England will be weaker on the world stage. The economy will fall, quality of life will plummet, etc. 
I propose a debate that involves the UK parliament to negotiate with the Australian parliament to form a union between the two.

attributes.action: Provide obese people with specialist help in their locality - it's their right
attributes.background: NHS guidelines say obese patients should have access to dedicated centres, staffed by experts in weight loss, exercise, and talking therapies, to help them reverse their weight gain prior to bariatric surgery. But this can be a postcode lottery.
attributes.additional_details: Obesity is often about much more than “just eat less”, otherwise millions of people would have just taken that advice. Guidelines recommend that prior to offering bariatric surgery (Tier 4) the NHS should provide help through dedicated centres staffed by experts in weight loss, exercise, and talking therapies, to help obese patients lose weight (Tier 3). This petition calls for more Tier 3 centres so all obese patients are able to access Tier 3 as a right.

attributes.action: Give mandatory sentences for criminal cases involving Child pornography
attributes.background:
Ex-Etonian Andrew Picard was given 10 month suspended prison sentence after thousands of child pornography images and clips were found on his hard drive.    Some shown children as young as two being raped and forced to have sex with dogs.

Give child pornography crimes mandatory sentences!!!
attributes.additional_details:
Number of detected crimes of people accessing child porn images increased by 46% between 2007-11 (BBC).

Up to 35,000 indecent images of children were found every day by police, some offenders caught with over 1 million.  In 1990 (pre internet boom) there were just 7,000 hard copy images in circulation.

The internet has unfortunately made child pornography more accessible.  Basic human rights should be respected by ALL UK citizens regardless of background, wealth and positions of power.

attributes.action: Government paying for a 10% discount on a house for a first time buyer.
attributes.background: First time buyers coming out of education find it extremely hard to get on the property ladder. This means that they will have to rent or live with their family. They won't be able to start a life. This small discount will make a huge difference in them starting a life.
attributes.additional_details: To stop scammers trying to abuse the system by immediately selling the house after the discount and making a profit, if the house (bought for the discount) was sold within the first 10 years then the discounted amount would be paid back to the government. Furthermore after any discounted house is sold a fraud investigator is sent to the house to ensure that no scamming is happening.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed freight hub at Gailey destroying our greenbelt land!
attributes.background: Government plans to build a railway freight hub on our greenbelt land are devastating our local community. We are fed up of being lied to. This is our wildlife and our peace and quiet - please get involved by signing our petition and stopping there being a 'one rule for one' culture with greenbelt!

attributes.action: Please bring back nhs funding for fertility treatment in South Norfolk.
attributes.background: Over the years families have got a few cycles of ivf on the nhs. This has reduced from a few cycles now to zero. I am so disheartened as we were waiting for the doctor to refer us before Christmas. We had to await blood tests.  After Christmas our GP tells us that nhs is now not funding this!
attributes.additional_details: Please bring back ivf funding in South Norfolk to help people who are trying to start a family.I feel if it comes to needing this my husband and I will not be able to afford to become parents.  This saddens us deeply as we are a hardworking couple (like many others) and pay tax every month but where is this money going?  We live in Norfolk but work in Suffolk so due to a postcode we can only be referred to Level 2 (further tests) but where to we go after that? we can't afford thousands of pounds

attributes.action: Hold a general Election in 2016 after the decision was made to leave the EU
attributes.background: The run up to the EU referendum has managed to prove that the Conservative government are not all of the same ideologies. In a time of vulnerability and Especially now the UK has to stand alone we need a Prime Minister that shows stability and integrity.

attributes.action: Stop the temporary closure of brookside children and adolescent unit
attributes.background: As you may or not know brookside is temporary closing down and for so many young children and families that is devastation. The unit covers four boroughs and takes referrals from all over the country. There is a waiting list of kids in crisis for this unit and many who need help being discharged.
attributes.additional_details:
CAMHS are already inundated with referrals and are having to turn people away. Yet with the closure of brookside they are going to be under more pressure and local hospitals and crisis teams are going to be stretched out with the lack of hospital beds. There is no beds in the country whilst brookside is open how can this mental health system afford to loose 18 inpatient and 16 day patient beds.
Please do not let another child be a statistic because there was no safe place.

attributes.action: Make Diabetics exempt from the sugar tax
attributes.background: Diabetics with a low blood sugar level need to consume glucose to stop progression to unconsciousness and possibly death. A glucose drink can be used, which can cost around £3.80 for a pack of 6. The sugar tax will increase the cost. This is unfair to the Diabetic population who need these drinks!
attributes.additional_details:
I wrote to the Department of Health in July 2015 outlining my concerns for Diabetics if a sugar tax were to be introduced, and received a reply which said: "The Government has no plans to introduce a sugar tax."

My concerns were obviously not taken into account when the announcement of a sugar tax was made.

attributes.action: Reopen Adcote House, Birkenhead, education unit to assess child's mental health
attributes.background: Adcote house, Birkenhead offers an educational unit with placements to help assess the mental health needs of children and young people. Due to government cut backs the unit is closed and many children including our 7 year old son who would be offered a placement aren't getting their needs met.
attributes.additional_details: Our 7 year old son is having assessments at CAMHS. He is a loving little boy whose emotional and social struggles affect him in everyday life, particularly the school environment. He would now be offered a 6 week educational placement at Adcote house to further assess his needs and get him the support he deserves. Frustratingly, he along with so many other children aren't getting their needs met due to government cut backs. Please help reopen a lifeline for families in already difficult times.

attributes.action: Open up the 16-24 age bracket for the Creative Employment Programme to 30+
attributes.background: The Creative Employment Programme is a £15m fund to support the creation of traineeships, formal apprenticeship and paid internship opportunities in England for young unemployed people aged 16-24 wishing to pursue a career in the arts and cultural sector.
attributes.additional_details:
This age cap should be opened up to at least 30 years old as is unfair to anyone over the age of 24 trying to get an entry level position within creative industries. This policy is ageist and due to it's popularity with employers able to get funding to support the job position there are many jobs that cannot be obtained by people over 24 purely because of their age.

The position should go to the person that best fits the job role and not to how old they are.

attributes.action: Review the Foreign Aid Policy  relating to Syrian refugees
attributes.background: Petition the government to review the Foreign Aid to the Syrian refugee’s estimated at £1.2 billion  when there are UK taxpayers, pensioners, families, people with chronic health conditions, and  homeless people who are reliant on handouts from food banks and charities to live a meagre existence.

attributes.action: Increase the bereavement compensation following a fatal accident
attributes.background:
The price of a life in England & Wales is only worth £12,980.
The loss of a loved one, a WIFE, HUSBAND or CHILD (under 18 years of age) according to the law is worth a pitiful £12,980.  We appreciate no amount of money can compensate for the loss, but the level of the award should be increased.
attributes.additional_details:
In Scotland, the award is considered on a case by case basis.  In a recent Scottish claim, for the loss of a child, the parents were awarded £100,000 yet in England & Wales they would have only received £12,980.  
Another example of how unjust the process can be, if a celebrity suffers hurt feelings they can be awarded around £200,000.00 yet a wife who suffers the death of her husband will only receive £12,980. 

Support us to change the law to make it fairer to grieving relatives.

attributes.action: Ease the criteria of Parent's dependant visa for settled migrants.
attributes.background: We believe that our parents are part of our family and the government has made the criteria for the dependant visa for parents very difficult. We would request the government to easy the criteria like remove the age limit and english language restrictions so that they can join us in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Most settled migrants and British Citizens are unable to live as a family due to the current difficult visa criteria for their parents and this has resulted in the migrants being unable to contribute their 100 percent due to a constant worry and concern for their families back home. We beleive that our parents should be able come and join us regardless of age and english language criteria. We completely understand about no recourse to public funds until fulfilling  a defined settlement criteria.

attributes.action: An unelected Prime Minister should call a general election within 6 months
attributes.background: In the interests of sovereignty, an unelected UK Prime Minister should hold a general election within six months of taking office.

attributes.action: Remove the 20% VAT that owners of sick pets are forced to pay.
attributes.background: I am a pet owner and live on a small income. My dog has helped me in lots of ways helped me through some tough times. I find 20% VAT on vet operations a rip off by this government for many pet owners and also many of those who are on small pensions.

attributes.action: Make  UK licensed bookmakers accept bets up to a minimum liability of £1000
attributes.background: It has become a common practice for bookmakers within the UK and those  that operate in the UK to restrict or close the account of  customers and / or to exempt some customers from participating in advertised promotions or enhanced  offers. These  widespread practises are unfair and  discriminate.
attributes.additional_details:
Special Terms should continue to be allowed to  apply to enhanced offers and  advertised promotions which may limit bet size  but changes must be made for all customers to be able to participate , without exclusion or  discrimination.

New South Wales, Australia  has recognised these  inequities  and has legislated to introduced the type of  regulation  we ask for in this petition.

attributes.action: Make the new £155 pension rate available to existing pensioners in April.
attributes.background: I and several friends over the age of 65 have paid more than the now required 30 years of contributions but will not receive the new £155 pension in April. I personally have paid conributions for 42 years but will receive no refund of my 12 years extra payment. Some have paid more. This is unfair.

attributes.action: Allow foreign nationals who are UK citizens of 3 yrs+ equal voting rights.
attributes.background: There are many foreign nationals living and working in the UK who have built businesses, set up families, own homes and who thus contribute to the UK economy in a way which should allow them a say regarding important decisions that affect them, such as the EU.

attributes.action: Call for Parliament to end tax-free status for ALL religious organisations in UK
attributes.background: Religion, whether you believe in it or not, is a business. It always has, and always will be. In 2013 the Church of England's revenue was £1.41 billion; taxed at just 5% would have generated £70,000,000! This is ONE religion in ONE year..! If there is a God, wouldn't he want to help our country...?
attributes.additional_details: As somebody who is fundamentally non-religious, I have always been amazed at the tax-free statuses of religious organisations. Even if God IS real, why should his representatives not pay tax? Their reason: They provide crucial social services, and that 200 years of church tax exemptions have not turned us into a theocracy. Taxing religious organisations won't make us a theocracy, especially if they're ALL taxed. Hospitals also provide social service, they're taxed; so why not religions..?

attributes.action: Decrease the amount universities can charge students for their tuition fees.
attributes.background: It is well known how much debt students will be left with once they have graduated from their respective degrees. It is time for parliament to review the maximum amount of tuition fees being charged to students in the U.K, as well as offering more financial support to those from low income families.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-34721681
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-26954901
http://www.independent.co.uk/student/news/jeremy-corbyn-england-should-be-utterly-ashamed-of-having-highest-tuition-fees-in-industrialised-a6860556.html

attributes.action: Life Imprisonment for the abuse, neglect and ill-treatment of children.
attributes.background: After reading of yet another child abused and eventually dying at the hands of the person who should have cared for her, we know in the past, sentencing in similar situations is lenient. If life imprisonment is mandatory upon conviction, it may act as a deterrent or stop the continuing abuse

attributes.action: The government must ensure schools provide instrumental lessons for all pupils
attributes.background: It has been proved beyond question that the experience of learning a musical instrument and playing in musical ensembles with others provides a complete 'brain work out' - developing skills that are not just related to music but also skills that enhance both learning and development throughout life
attributes.additional_details: There have been numerous studies showing the cognitive development of children who play an instrument when compared to those that don't and all the evidence makes it quite clear that the the benefits of learning a musical instrument helps education and development in all subjects for everyone as the skills required for instrumental playing are all essential skills in everyday life.

attributes.action: Guidance on workplace bullying must be applied to behaviour of MPs at work.
attributes.background: The rules covering conduct during parliamentary debate must be updated to reflect the level of conduct expected generally in the workplace.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like our representatives to treat each other with respect, to listen properly to each others views, to debate the matter at hand and to answer direct questions with full and truthful answers.

("Bullying may be characterised as offensive, intimidating, malicious or insulting behaviour, an abuse or misuse of power through means that undermine, humiliate, denigrate or injure the recipient." - From the ACAS website)

attributes.action: Enforce use of stun guns in halal slaughterhouses.
attributes.background:
We are a nation of animal lovers..yet we allow animals to endure horrific, painful deaths on our soil. 
The animals in halal slaughter houses who do not use stunguns, flail and scream in pain for up to 5 minutes before they die. THIS IS NOT NECESSARY FOR HALAL.
attributes.additional_details:
There a number of sickening videos online of animals dying horrific deaths in halal slaughterhouses..i strongly reccommend you view these to understand fully the emergence of this petition.
There are also articles written by top muslim scholars who agree that stunning the animal does not go against the rules in the Qu'ran. To kill an animal with a blow to the head is forbidden, but to stun them with stungun (which is placed on the head) is permitted.
 The animal is still alive and the blood will still pump out as is necessary for halal meat.

attributes.action: Give legal immunity to military personal who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan.
attributes.background: The current legal witch hunt of our military personnel who fought in Iraq and Afghanistan is wholly unacceptable and I call upon the government to bring a stop to criminalising our veterans and damaging the military covenant even more than it already is.
attributes.additional_details: American military personnel are protected by their government from such things, why not ours?

attributes.action: Clean Up City Air: Ban Harmful Diesel Engined, Air-Polluting Public Transport
attributes.background: Public transport should not cause harm to public health. Diesel exhaust is one of the biggest causes of air pollution, which is linked to 40,000 early deaths every year, causing diseases including cancer, dementia, and heart disease. It is time for a healthy alternative energy for public transport.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal College of Physicians recently stated "The health problems resulting from exposure to air pollution have a high cost to society and business, our health services, and people who suffer from illness and premature death. In the UK, these costs add up to more than £20 billion every year.  Taking action will reduce pain, suffering and demands on the NHS, while getting people back to work, learning, and an active life. The value of these benefits far exceeds the cost of reducing emissions."

attributes.action: Introduce NHS funding for Forensic Psychology doctorate students
attributes.background: The NHS funds Clinical Psychology doctoral students so that they are able to complete their training whilst earning a fair salary. This means that anyone can apply to do the Clinical Psychology doctorate. The Forensic Psychology doctorate is not only NOT funded, but must be paid for (over £7000/yr).
attributes.additional_details: The Forensic Psychology doctorate is a professional training course during which you are on placement full-time, whilst also conducting thesis research. However, the full-time work that students undertake on placements (often within NHS establishments, e.g. secure hospitals) is completely unpaid. This means that Forensic Psychology doctorate students have to find a way to pay the course fees and be able to work for free for 2 years. I believe the Forensic Doctorate should be funded by the NHS.

attributes.action: Reinstate the use of bevacizumab (Avastin) for use on all Cancers.
attributes.background: Colin has bowel cancer.  He had treatment,chemo and operations to remove cancer.  After Avastin the cancer showed significant shrinkage. We must get this drug reinstated for everybody that needs it.
attributes.additional_details:
Avastin works by targeting proteins on cancer cells called VEGF cutting the oxygen to the tumour.  Avastin has been shown to work on many cancers.  It is available on the NHS in Scotland and Wales.  Why has it been de-listed in England since 4th November, 2015.  
This is a targeted therapy that really works and has been proven to work.  Doctors and oncologists want it back because they know it works

attributes.action: DNA test and fingerprint needles left in the street, and prosecute the criminal
attributes.background: The public get stabbed by needles left in the street by drug users and have to wait 6 months to see If they caught HIV or Hepatitis A/B/C. Drug users who throw their needles on the street should be prosecuted with a minimum sentence. A simple test for DNA and fingerprinting will catch the criminal.
attributes.additional_details: The two techniques are used for very small crimes such as vehicle interference or trespassing. Sin bins and needle exchange has been provided for drug users as we understand their addiction therefore they is no excuse to put the public in danger of diseases. Children play on the street innocently because they are unaware of the risk of a needle which could change their life forever, smoking in the same car as a child is child abuse therefore how come giving a child a disease isn't abuse.
